meanings.definition: Make (a person or animal) immune to infection by vaccination.
meanings.sent1: The doctor is immunising the children against measles.
meanings.sent2: The nurse is immunising the puppies to protect them from getting sick.
meanings.sent3: The clown tried immunising the balloons against popping by giving them tiny shields.
meanings.sent4: The superhero's shield was like an immunising force, protecting him from all harm.
meanings.sent5: The magical potion had the power of immunising the wizard from any spell cast upon him.

meanings.definition: Make (a person or animal) immune to a disease.
meanings.sent1: The pharmacist is immunising the elderly against the flu.
meanings.sent2: The vet is immunising the kittens to keep them healthy.
meanings.sent3: The chef tried immunising the soup against tasting bland by adding extra spices.
meanings.sent4: The love of music was like immunising her soul against sadness.
meanings.sent5: The golden amulet had the ability of immunising its wearer from any curse.
